description.short: A massive rectangular castle overlooking the Danube River in Bratislava.
description.long: Bratislava Castle is an iconic symbol of Slovakia’s capital. Perched on a hill overlooking the Danube River, it has a rich history dating back to the Stone Age. The castle now houses museums, and its grounds offer panoramic views of the city and surrounding areas.

image.alt: Bratislava Castle overlooking the Danube River

description.short: One of the largest castle ruins in Central Europe, located in eastern Slovakia.
description.long: Spiš Castle is a UNESCO World Heritage site and one of the largest medieval castles in Central Europe. Its ruins sit on a hilltop, offering sweeping views of the surrounding countryside. The castle complex includes a museum detailing its history and archaeology.

image.alt: Ruins of Spiš Castle on a hilltop

description.short: A majestic mountain range with stunning peaks, valleys, and lakes.
description.long: The High Tatras are Slovakia’s highest mountain range, known for their dramatic peaks, deep valleys, and crystal-clear mountain lakes. Popular for hiking, skiing, and outdoor activities, the region is also home to rich flora and fauna, making it a top destination for nature lovers.

image.alt: Mountain peaks in the High Tatras
image.license: Creative Commons Zero, Public Domain Dedication

description.short: A fairy-tale castle known for its romantic architecture and rich history.
description.long: Bojnice Castle is one of the most beautiful and visited castles in Slovakia. With its romantic appearance, it resembles something from a fairy tale. The castle is known for its art collection, historic furnishings, and regular events, including a popular international ghost festival.

image.alt: Bojnice Castle with its fairy-tale architecture

description.short: A historic castle ruin located at the confluence of the Danube and Morava rivers.
description.long: Devin Castle, located near Bratislava, is a significant archaeological and historical site in Slovakia. Perched on a cliff above the Danube, it offers spectacular views and is known for its role in the early history of the Slovak people and as a symbol of Slovak independence.

name: Demänovská Cave of Liberty (Demänovská jaskyňa slobody)

description.short: One of Slovakia's most beautiful caves, located in the Low Tatras.
description.long: Demänovská Cave of Liberty is part of the Demänovská Valley cave system and is one of the most visited caves in Slovakia. The cave features stunning formations of stalactites, stalagmites, and underground lakes, making it a popular destination for nature enthusiasts.

image.alt: Stalactites and stalagmites in Demänovská Cave of Liberty
image.license: Jojo Multi-license with GFDL and Creative Commons CC-BY-SA-2.5 and older versions (2.0 and 1.0)

description.short: A UNESCO World Heritage site and preserved folk village in the mountains.
description.long: Vlkolínec is a small, well-preserved folk village in the heart of Slovakia, recognized by UNESCO for its traditional wooden architecture. The village, surrounded by the picturesque mountains of the Velká Fatra, offers visitors a glimpse into Slovakia’s rural past and cultural heritage.

image.license: Creative Commons Zero, Public Domain Dedication

description.short: A stunning national park known for its gorges, waterfalls, and hiking trails.
description.long: Slovak Paradise is a national park famous for its rugged gorges, deep canyons, and dense forests. Popular among hikers and nature lovers, the park features well-marked trails, many of which include ladders and bridges to navigate the challenging terrain. It's a haven for outdoor enthusiasts.

image.alt: Waterfalls and hiking trails in Slovak Paradise National Park
image.license: Creative Commons Zero, Public Domain Dedication

description.short: A medieval castle located on a cliff above the Orava River.
description.long: Orava Castle is one of the most well-preserved castles in Slovakia, standing on a high cliff overlooking the Orava River. It was built in the 13th century and has since been a key historical landmark, showcasing medieval architecture, art, and life through its museum exhibits.

image.alt: Orava Castle perched on a cliff

description.short: A historic mining town and UNESCO World Heritage site.
description.long: Banská Štiavnica is a picturesque medieval town, known for its mining history and charming architecture. The town was once a key center for silver mining in Europe, and its old town center, mining infrastructure, and beautiful surroundings are now protected as a UNESCO World Heritage site.

image.license: Creative Commons Zero, Public Domain Dedication
